{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following is not involved in blood clotting, we need to review the relevant documents. Document [0] explains that coagulation involves activation, adhesion, and aggregation of platelets, as well as deposition and maturation of fibrin. Document [3] states that clotting occurs in association with membranes on the surface of platelets and damaged blood vessels. Document [5] mentions that fibrinogen concentration is critical to blood clot formation. Document [9] states that clotting factors XIII, XII, XI, X, IX, VII, V, II, and I are manufactured principally in hepatocytes. Document [18] explains that thrombocytes are the components of blood involved in blood clotting. Based on this information, we can determine that all of the options (A. Calcium, B. Prothrombin, C.
